sub_title: Senior Asset Manager @ MTU Aero Engines with expertise in Aircraft Engine Analysis and Asset Management
summary:
With over 20 years of multidimensional experience in the aviation industry, I am a Senior Asset Manager at MTU Aero Engines, a leading global provider of commercial jet engine solutions. As a CFM56 engine asset management specialist, I oversee all purchasing and sales for commercial jet engine material requirements, participate actively in winning shop visit campaigns for MTU MRO shops, and provide modular solutions to MTU customers.

I have a strong technical background as a type rated aircraft engineer on Airbus A320 and Boeing 737NG, as well as a Bachelor of Technology in Aeronautical Engineering and a membership of the Royal Aeronautical Society. I combine my technical and commercial skills to evaluate and appraise assets with accuracy and efficiency, from birth to end of life cycle. I also monitor inventories, maintain and grow market share, and coordinate with quality focal points to ensure compliance with aviation standards. My mission is to deliver optimal value and performance for my organization and its clients.

profile_positions.description:
Oversee all purchasing and sales for commercial jet engine material requirements
Participate actively to win Shop visit campaigns for MTU MRO shops.
Provide modular solutions to MTU customer 
Evaluates CFM56 series engines for acquisition and/or part out
Analyses trends to identify opportunities and markets in the Engine components and products and services to Engine Maintenance Repair and Overhaul Companies & Airlines
Coordinates with Quality Focal Point to ensure operations and inventory are in accordance with Aviation Standards
Monitor inventories in a cost-effective way to maximise cash flow
Maintain and grow market share in existing customer base while recognising untapped revenue streams in airlines
Create and enhance all teardown models for Commercial engines
Create and submit business cases including IRR, NPV, Gross Margin, Residual Core Values, and cash flows for all opportunities on the asset level
Review and recommend changes to all analytical data bases while also inventing new ways to analyse data such as a quality index for assigning FMV to particular parts, or overall packages of inventory
Work with a team of analysts and developers to create and maintain data bases to make strategic purchases of tier 1 material, while looking to create demand, recognise possible market opportunities, and build/utilise strategic relationships
Work collaboratively with all departments to create, enhance, and implement different data reports
Possess a drive to acquire new customers
Develop sales strategies and market full range of service products
Prepare and negotiate proposals and conduct customer presentations
Responsible for debit management of respective customers
Evaluate marketing strategy based on objectives, market characteristics, and cost and mark up factors
profile_positions.title: Senior Asset Manager

profile_positions.description:
Development of the Aero Engine Division with Complete Blueprint of Business Strategy
Development of go-to-market strategy to ensure lowest cost for key product lines.
Mentoring procurement & Sales team to secure best pricing and deploy creative strategies.
Leading negotiations and execution of strategic inventory agreements across a global vendor base.
Development of metrics and reporting standards for inventory turns and cost avoidance goals.
Performing routine reporting of actual vs. plan performance and corrective actions for sales, profits, inventory levels, and strategic account growth.
Capturing and making available key competitor and market intelligence (sources, conditions, price).
Ensuring acquired inventory meets TDA quality standards and coordinating with TDA QA to understand issues and build procurement processes to avoid future shortfalls.
Working cross-functionally within TDA Group to leverage acquisition opportunities, ensuring that inventory acquired via engine acquisitions is considered in parts supply forecasting.
Develop sales strategies and market full range of service products
Provide market intelligence to support strategic and operational planning
Prepare and negotiate proposals and conduct customer presentations
Capacity to proactively manage customer requirements
Continuously develop and improve product and service offerings
Management of procurement team to secure forecast demands in advance of need.
profile_positions.title: Associate Director - Engines

profile_positions.description:
Source and procure Engine teardown candidates that will assist in meeting Engine component demand. 
Generated over USD 70 Mio Revenue in 24 months on Asset Management. 
Created Strategic partnership with various MRO,  operators and lessors.
Actively associated in winning multiple engine shop visit campaigns for MTU MRO Network.
Identification and procurement of Engine inventory to meet demands. 
Purchase negotiations for potential lease engines to be inducted in the portfolio. 
Provide guidance and pricing methodology for Engine and component acquisitions and support sales campaigns. 
Identify Engine components that require repair/overhaul investment to maximize financial returns 
Review Assets to be purchased. 
Create Engine Back to Births and review complete trace-ability of assets. 
Due-diligence review of technical records. 
Capture market intelligence for inventory availability and pricing. 
Max power assurance (MPA) run overview. 
Identify future demand for Airlines and MRO Partners and the global market place. 
MRO contract negotiations and selection for potential shop visits. 
Physical Inspection of assets (engines). 
Disposition parts for repair based on the marketability of the part and vendor cost. 
Support the Sales, Assets and Programs groups. 
End of Lease inspection
Lease return of Asset

Analyze Aircraft components and packages for procurement 
Maximize revenue and margin objectives for the product line
Generate and evaluate market and end-user customer inquiries; formulate strategy and direct proposal efforts to sell the product

profile_positions.title: Asset Manager
Aircraft Lessor Rep. ( Technical)

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the technical aircraft maintenance engineering for the Airbus A320-232 fitted with IAE V2527-A5 Engines aircraft and AIRBUS A320-214 fitted with CFM 56-5B ENGINES. 
•	Maintain and overhaul aircrafts and sub-assemblies in accordance with established maintenance schedules, including inspections, testing, repairs and installations of engine systems and components. 
•	Certify aircraft are airworthy in accordance with local and international aviation standards. 
•	Manage the ordering of inventory parts needed to ensure works can be carried out speedily and efficiently. 
•	Ensure compliance with applicable technical publications through the use of maintenance instruction manuals for the appropriate type/model/series aircraft. 
•	Attend all site meetings, keep up to date with changes in Indigo engineering and procedures, and ensure all works completed are done in a safe and efficient manner. 
•	Interface with higher level commands, activities, and depots on all maintenance-related issues. 
•	Reassemble components and check for operational deficiency. 
•	Ensure that aircraft and equipment maintenance data is collected and properly disseminated, and maintaining a record of all action taken. 
•	Provide leadership to junior engineer members.
•	Establishing Parts status and ensuring availability; raising parts requests when requested
. Mentoring aircraft maintenance technicians to prepare them to be eligible for working as Aircraft maintenance engineers.
profile_positions.title: Aircraft Engineer ( Airframe & Engine)

profile_positions.description:
Appointed to provide on Ground Maintenance / AOG situation for all levels of flight services ranging from snag rectification , component changing to troubleshooting through Manpower Managements. 
•	Maintain a detailed handover Log between shifts 
•	To ensure that all scheduled & un-scheduled maintenance is carried out in accordance with Airlines and regulatory requirements
•	Ensure that tasks are carried out only within the limitations of the company issued approval
•	Ensuring that all maintenance is carried out to the highest standards and within the operational limitations prescribed
•	Completion of work packages as issued by Maintrol
•	Reporting to maintrol on status of ADDS/CDDS/MEL
•	Assisting in recovery of AOG Aircraft
profile_positions.title: Lead Aircraft Mechanic

volunteer_experiences.description: Training junior aircraft maintenance technicians to become eligible for working as Aircraft maintenance engineer and to have better knowledge about aircraft maintenance.
